content:
Diagnosis:	Granulosa cell tumor of ovary, Stage IC

Management:	Total abdominal hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy March 2024

Histology:	Adult-type granulosa cell tumor, FOXL2 mutation positive, Stage IC (capsule rupture)

Current Situation:	First post-operative follow-up

I reviewed [redacted name] today following her surgery in March. She has made an excellent recovery from her operation with good wound healing. Her post-operative pain has now resolved and she has returned to most normal activities. She denies any new symptoms of concern. Her appetite is good and weight stable.

On examination today, her abdomen is soft and non-tender with well-healed surgical scars. There is no clinical evidence of disease recurrence.

Her latest blood tests from 15/4/24 show inhibin B has normalized to <10 pg/mL (pre-operative level 285 pg/mL). Other tumor markers remain normal.

Given her Stage IC disease with capsular rupture, we have discussed the role of adjuvant chemotherapy. However, as she has had complete surgical resection with normalized tumor markers and no high-risk features, we have agreed to proceed with surveillance alone at this stage.

The plan is for 3-monthly follow-up with inhibin B measurements and annual CT scanning. I will see her again in clinic in July 2024 with repeat blood tests. She understands to contact us sooner if she develops any concerning symptoms in the interim.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: Adult-type granulosa cell tumor with capsule rupture

cancer_timeline.value: Total abdominal hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy

patient_facts.value: Abdomen soft and non-tender with well-healed surgical scars, no clinical evidence of disease recurrence
Inhibin B <10 pg/mL, other tumor markers normal

status_updates.value: Stage IC granulosa cell tumor of ovary post complete surgical resection. Excellent post-operative recovery with normalized tumor markers
Decision for surveillance alone rather than adjuvant chemotherapy given complete resection and absence of high-risk features
3-monthly inhibin B measurements and annual CT scanning
Review in clinic July 2024 with repeat blood tests
